Class Company

java.lang.Object
Company
All Implemented Interfaces:
Locatable
public class Company
extends java.lang.Object
implements Locatable
Company is a class that holds Customer's, Employee's, Delivery's and also implements Locatable interface. A Company can make its employees deliver deliveries, fire and hire employees, and gain customers.
Version:
1.5, 10/03/2021
Author:
Tolga Ozgun
See Also:
Customer, Employee, Delivery, Locatable

    boolean createDeliverable​(Item sendItem, Customer sender, Customer receiver)
    Creates a new job for an available employee if there is an employee available to take the job.

    • terminateContract

      public boolean terminateContract​(int employeeIndex)

      Returns:
      Boolean whether the operation was successful.

    • createDeliverable

      public boolean createDeliverable​(Item sendItem, Customer sender, Customer receiver)
      Creates a new job for an available employee if there is an employee available to take the job.
      Parameters:
      sendItem - Item object of the item to be sent.
      sender - Customer object of the sender.
      receiver - Customer object of the receiver.
      Returns:
      Boolean whether the delivery is accepted.

    • deliverPackages

      public void deliverPackages()
      Delivers the packages of all employees working in this company. Prints out the delivery information.
      See Also:
      Employee.deliverPackages()
